H0.text: who is hammurabi and what did he do. Lawgiver

H1.text: who is hammurabi and what did he do. Emperor

H2.text: who is hammurabi and what did he do. Judge

H3.text: who is hammurabi and what did he do. Monarch

A4.text: Hammurabi is best known for having issued his eponymous code, which he claimed to have received from Shamash, the Babylonian god of justice.

A5.text: Hammurabi was the sixth Amorite king of the Old Babylonian Empire, reigning from c. 1792 to c. 1750 BC.

A6.text: Anum, along with the Babylonian wind god Enlil, chose Hammurabi to be Babylon's king.

A7.text: Hammurabi was to rule 'to prevent the strong from oppressing the weak' (37–39: dannum enšam ana lā ḫabālim).
